Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm's steal and subsequent scoring from second base gave the Yankees the lead for good.
Tommy Kahnle and Luke Weaver combined to keep Kansas City scoreless over the final two innings.
Weaver recorded the final four outs, three via strikeout.
Weaver struck out Bobby Witt Jr. on a fastball Witt thought was too low.
Post-Match Reflections: Royals manager Matt Quatraro expressed his opinion that the Royals had a good argument to get the overturned call at second base.
Jazz Chisholm reflected on the bang-bang play at second base saying, 'I knew I was in there.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees acquired Jazz Chisholm from the Miami Marlins at the trade deadline for his speed and athleticism.
Chisholm's exploits on the basepaths showcased one of the reasons New York acquired him.
Others: The game was a seesaw clash between the Yankees and the Kansas City Royals in Game 1 of the American League Division Series.
